abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that currently seven of nine players on the American League All-Star team come from the Kansas City Royals, including Omar Infante, who has had objectively sub-par season; contends that outcome shows how popular balloting, and outpouring of effort from fans of a particular team, can result in All-Star game that does not feature best players.
lead_paragraph: The total number cast, 420 million, far exceeded the record of 391 million set in 2012, but the craziness continued as Royals players held down seven of the nine spots on the American League team.

headline.main: All-Star Votes Grow in Number, if Not in Value
headline.print_headline: All-Star Voting Is Booming, but at a Cost

snippet: The total number cast, 420 million, far exceeded the record of 391 million set in 2012, but the craziness continued as Royals players held down seven of the nine spots on the American League team.
